Conduct may be founded on the hard rock or the wet marshes, but after a certain point I don’t care what it’s founded on. When I came back from the East last autumn I felt that I wanted the world to be in uniform and at a sort of moral attention forever; I wanted no more riotous excursions with privileged glimpses into the human heart. Only Gatsby, the man who gives his name to this book, was exempt from my reaction—Gatsby, who represented everything for which I have an unaffected scorn. en_second_half: was something gorgeous about him, some heightened sensitivity to the promises of life, as if he were related to one of those intricate machines that register earthquakes ten thousand miles away. This responsiveness had nothing to do with that flabby impressionability which is dignified under the name of the “creative temperament”—it was an extraordinary gift for hope, a romantic readiness such as I have never found in any other person and which it is not likely I shall ever find again. No—Gatsby turned out all right at the end; it is what preyed on Gatsby, what foul dust floated in the wake of his dreams that temporarily closed out my interest in the abortive sorrows and short-winded elations of men.
en_results: output>And so, I found myself torn between the desire for a world that was orderly and predictable, and the recognition that such a world would be devoid of the very things that made life worth living—chaos, unpredictability, and the unexpected encounters that shape our understanding of humanity. Gatsby, with his enigmatic charm and his unyielding pursuit of the American dream, stood as a beacon of everything I both admired and despised. His parties, his lavish displays of wealth, and his unwavering belief in the possibility of love transcending all obstacles were the very things that made him an anomaly in my world. es_second_half: una exacerbada sensibilidad para las promesas de la vida, como si estuviera conectado a una de esas máquinas complejísimas que registran terremotos a quince mil kilómetros de distancia. es_results_raw: En el corazón de Gatsby, había una aspiración que, aunque no era noble, era intensa. Era la búsqueda de algo que parecía escaparle, algo que él creía que podría encontrar en el brillo de sus sueños. Sin embargo, lo que realmente encontró fue la ilusión de una vida que nunca podría alcanzar. Su deseo de pertenencia, de ser aceptado en un mundo que siempre le rechazó, lo llevó a construir una fachada que ocultaba su verdadera identidad. Era un hombre que, a pesar de todo, no podía renunciar a la esperanza, aunque esta se desvaneciera con cada paso que daba. La vida de Gatsby es una historia de ilusiones que se desmoronan, de sueños que se evaporan en el viento. Pero, a pesar de todo, hay algo en él que no puede ser ignorado: su pasión, su deseo de vivir plenamente, aunque sea en un mundo que le es hostil. Gatsby es un hombre que, a su manera, lucha por ser alguien, por encontrar un lugar en el mundo. Y aunque su historia termina en desastre, su legado perdura, una advertencia sobre la fragilidad de las ilusiones y la importancia de no perder la esperanza. En el final, Gatsby es un hombre que, a pesar de todo, no renunció a su sueño, y eso es lo que realmente importa. La vida de Gatsby es una lección sobre la importancia de luchar por lo que creemos que vale la pena, incluso cuando las probabilidades parecen estar en contra. Y aunque su historia termina en desastre, su legado perdura, una advertencia sobre la fragilidad de las ilusiones y la importancia de no perder la esperanza.

en_results_raw: And so it happened that on a warm windy evening I drove over to East Egg to see two old friends whom I scarcely knew at all. Their house was even more elaborate than I expected, a cheerful red-and-white Georgian Colonial mansion, overlooking the bay. The lawn started at the beach and ran towards the front door for a quarter of a mile, jumping over a small stream that meandered through the property. The air was filled with the scent of saltwater and wildflowers, and the sound of the wind rustling through the trees created a soothing melody. Inside, the house was a perfect blend of old-world charm and modern comfort, with high ceilings and large windows that allowed the natural light to flood the rooms. The friends, who had been inseparable in their youth, greeted me warmly, and we spent the evening reminiscing about the past, sharing stories and laughter. As the night wore on, we moved to the terrace, where we could watch the stars twinkle over the water. The evening was a bittersweet reminder of how time passes, yet the bonds of friendship endure. The wind had died down by then, and the only sound was the gentle lapping of the waves against the shore. It was a night that would stay with me forever, a perfect blend of nostalgia and new beginnings.

es_results_raw: Después de cruzar el umbral de la mansión, me recibieron con una sonrisa sincera, como si hubieran sabido que vendría. La casa estaba llena de detalles que hablaban de una vida llena de refinamiento y elegancia. En la sala de estar, las estanterías estaban repletas de libros antiguos y valiosos, y en la chimenea, un fuego de leña crepitaba suavemente, proyectando sombras danzantes sobre las paredes. En la terraza, disfrutamos de una copa de vino mientras contemplábamos el atardecer que pintaba la bahía de colores dorados y rojizos. Hablamos de viejos tiempos, de nuestras vidas y de cómo habían cambiado, pero también de los sueños que aún manteníamos. Aunque apenas los conocía, sentí una conexión profunda con ellos, como si hubiéramos compartido más de lo que recordábamos. La velada fue inolvidable, y cuando finalmente me despedí de ellos, prometí volver pronto. En el camino de regreso a casa, el viento soplaba con más fuerza, trayendo consigo el aroma de la sal y el mar. Era una tarde que me recordaría siempre, una mezcla de calor, viento y la amistad que se forja en lugares como ese.

I felt a strange sense of detachment, as if I were observing a scene from a distance, not fully part of it. The air in the room seemed thick, almost oppressive, and I could feel the weight of their presence pressing down on me. I took a step forward, my heart pounding in my chest, and then another, until I was standing directly in front of them. Their eyes remained fixed on some unseen point beyond me, and I could see the faintest hint of a smile playing on their lips, as though they were privy to some secret that I would never understand. The room began to spin around me, and I felt a sudden urge to flee, but my feet were rooted to the spot, unable to move. It was only when I heard the soft sound of footsteps approaching from the hallway that I finally managed to tear my gaze away from them and turn to face the door.

en_results_raw: I looked at Miss Baker, wondering what it was she “got done.” I enjoyed looking at her. She was a slender, small-breasted girl, with an erect carriage, which she accentuated by throwing her body backward at the shoulders like a swan. Her movements were graceful, and I found myself captivated by her presence. The way she walked, her head held high, exuded confidence that was both alluring and mysterious. I couldn’t help but imagine what kind of life she led, and what secrets she might be hiding behind those piercing eyes. Her slender fingers, adorned with delicate jewelry, seemed to dance as she moved, adding to her charm. I found myself lost in thought, wondering if she knew how much she affected me. The room seemed to grow quieter, the only sound being the soft rustling of her dress as she moved gracefully across the room. I felt a strange mix of admiration and curiosity, unsure of what to make of her.

en_first_half: “It’ll show you how I’ve gotten to feel about—things. Well, she was less than an hour old and Tom was God knows where. I woke up out of the ether with an utterly abandoned feeling, and asked the nurse right away if it was a boy or
en_second_half: a girl. She told me it was a girl, and so I turned my head away and wept. ‘All right,’ I said, ‘I’m glad it’s a girl. And I hope she’ll be a fool—that’s the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool.’
en_results: completion>As I waited for the nurse's response, a wave of exhaustion washed over me. The sterile hospital room felt like a tomb, and the beeping of machines in the background only added to the surreal atmosphere. I had no
en_results_raw: completion>As I waited for the nurse's response, a wave of exhaustion washed over me. The sterile hospital room felt like a tomb, and the beeping of machines in the background only added to the surreal atmosphere. I had no idea what to expect, no one to turn to, and no sense of what was happening. The nurse finally came back, her face a mask of professionalism, and told me it was a girl. I stared at her, my heart pounding in my chest. "A girl," I repeated, trying to make sense of the words. The nurse handed me the tiny bundle, and I held her for the first time. Her tiny fingers curled around mine, and I felt a strange mix of fear and love. I had no idea how to be a mother, but in that moment, I knew I had to try. The next few days were a blur of exhaustion and wonder. I learned to feed her, change her, and hold her close. Slowly, I began to feel less alone, less abandoned. Tom still hadn't returned, and I wasn't sure if he ever would. But I had this little girl, and that was enough for now. As the weeks passed, I realized that motherhood wasn't just about the practicalities, it was about love, patience, and resilience. I had a long journey ahead, but I was determined to be the best mother I could be, no matter the circumstances.

en_results_raw: As the years passed, the once vibrant names on the timetable faded, a silent testament to the fleeting nature of gatherings. The paper, now brittle and yellowed, held onto the memory of a summer filled with laughter and whispers of secrets. I often wonder what became of those who attended Gatsby's parties. Did they remember the nights they spent there, or had they long since forgotten the grandeur of the mansion and the charm of the host? The timetable, a relic of a bygone era, serves as a reminder of the transient nature of human connections. It is a small, unassuming object that carries within it the echoes of a past that is now distant and almost forgotten. Yet, it remains, a silent witness to a time when dreams and reality intertwined in the shadow of the Great Gatsby.

es_results_raw: Y entonces llegó aquel viaje desconcertante. No habíamos pasado todavía West Egg Village cuando Gatsby empezó a dejar sin control su voz, hablando de una manera que no parecía propia de él. Hablaba de una mujer, una mujer que él amaba y que ahora se había ido, dejándolo solo en ese mundo que ya no entendía. La luz del sol se filtraba entre las nubes, iluminando el camino que llevaba a una nueva aventura, pero en su corazón solo había tristeza y nostalgia. Gatsby sabía que ese viaje cambiaría su vida para siempre, aunque no estaba seguro de si sería para mejor o para peor.

en_results_raw: He wouldn’t say another word. His correctness grew on him as we neared the city. We passed Port Roosevelt, where there was a glimpse of red-belted oceangoing ships, and sped along a cobbled slum lined with the dark, decaying buildings that seemed to whisper secrets of the past. The air was thick with the scent of salt and something else, perhaps fear or anticipation. As we approached the city gates, the hum of activity grew louder, a cacophony of voices and footsteps that contrasted sharply with the silence that had surrounded us in the countryside. The gates loomed large, their iron bars rusted but still formidable, guarding the entrance to a world that seemed both familiar and alien. Inside, the streets were bustling with people, their faces a mix of curiosity and caution. It was clear that we had entered a place where every glance and gesture held a story, and the weight of history pressed down on every corner.

Las casas de alrededor eran de un color uniforme, con balcones que se extendían sobre las calles. En el centro de la plaza, un monumento antiguo, cubierto de hollín, recordaba los tiempos pasados. Daisy's mother, a stern woman with a reputation for strictness, confronted her daughter, but Daisy was resolute. She explained that she was leaving to pursue her dreams, which her mother dismissed as nonsense. Despite the tension, Daisy's mother could not stop her, and Daisy left, disappearing into the city's nightlife. In the following months, Daisy's name became synonymous with scandal, and her mother's social standing was severely damaged. Meanwhile, I continued to play in tournaments, my life a stark contrast to Daisy's. I found solace in the competitive world of chess, where I could focus on strategy and skill rather than the drama that seemed to follow Daisy everywhere.

en_results_raw: In the world of high society, Daisy was a beacon of elegance and charm. Her parties were legendary, drawing the cream of Chicago's elite. She was known for her impeccable taste in fashion and her ability to make everyone around her feel special. However, beneath the surface, there was a complexity to Daisy that not many truly understood. She was deeply insecure about her marriage to Tom, often questioning whether she had made the right choice. Despite her outward confidence, Daisy struggled with feelings of inadequacy, which she tried to mask with her vibrant social life. Her relationship with Tom was strained, marked by infidelity and unspoken resentments. Yet, she remained committed, torn between her desire for a stable life and her need for excitement. As the years passed, Daisy's world began to unravel, and the glittering facade she had built around herself started to crack. The pressures of maintaining her image and the toll of her tumultuous marriage took their toll on her, leaving her a shadow of the vibrant woman she once was.

Người chồng của cô, một doanh nhân thành đạt, thường mang đến những câu chuyện về kinh doanh và sự thành công của mình. Tuy nhiên, giữa những cuộc trò chuyện sôi nổi, em nhận ra rằng họ cũng có những khoảng lặng, những khoảnh khắc riêng tư mà họ không muốn chia sẻ với người khác. Những lần gặp gỡ sau đó ở Chicago luôn mang đến cho em cảm giác yên bình và gần gũi hơn. Em thường đi dạo cùng Daisy trong những con phố quen thuộc của thành phố, ngắm nhìn những cửa hiệu nhỏ và thưởng thức những món ăn đường phố. Những khoảnh khắc đó, em cảm thấy như mình đã tìm thấy một người bạn chân thật và đáng tin cậy. Dù cuộc sống của họ vẫn tiếp tục xoay quanh những cuộc tụ tập và sự nổi tiếng, nhưng em tin rằng họ vẫn có những khoảnh khắc riêng biệt mà chỉ có họ mới hiểu được.

es_results_raw: En Chicago, Daisy se convirtió rápidamente en el centro de atención de la alta sociedad. Su casa en la Quinta Avenida se convirtió en el lugar donde las personas más influyentes de la ciudad se reunían para fiestas y eventos. Sin embargo, detrás de la apariencia brillante de Daisy, había una profunda tristeza que solo ella conocía. Su esposo, Tom, parecía distante, y aunque ella intentaba mantener una sonrisa, el vacío en su corazón era cada vez más evidente. Aunque parecía que todo estaba bien en la superficie, Daisy estaba luchando internamente con la soledad y la nostalgia de su vida en Europa. A menudo, se encontraba recordando los días en Cannes y Deauville, donde la vida era más simple y libre. A pesar de su éxito, Daisy sentía que algo le faltaba, y esa sensación de incompletitud no la abandonaba. A medida que los años pasaban, la relación de Daisy con Tom se deterioraba, y la vida en Chicago comenzó a parecerle cada vez más insípida. Sin embargo, la historia de Daisy no terminaba ahí, y el futuro que le esperaba estaba lleno de misterio y desafíos que aún no se habían revelado.

We paused by a small fountain, its water cascading into a basin lined with smooth stones. The tranquility of the moment was perfect, a perfect escape from the world outside. As we continued our walk, Daisy pointed out the intricate carvings on the old stone benches, each one telling a story of the past. The day was drawing to a close, and the sky was painted with hues of orange and pink, a fitting backdrop for the fairy tale-like scene before us.

The moonlight cast a silvery glow over the pool, and I could hear the distant sound of music from Gatsby's house. I felt a strange sense of anticipation, as if the night held secrets I was not meant to uncover. The swimming party had a life of its own, a fleeting moment of joy before the dawn. Gatsby finally appeared, his eyes sparkling with excitement. "Ready?" he asked, and I nodded, stepping into the night with him, unsure of what awaited but eager to find out. The garden seemed to whisper with possibilities, and I followed Gatsby, drawn into a world where the boundaries between reality and fantasy blurred.

es_results_raw: Esa noche, el jardín parecía un refugio mágico, con las luces de las farolas proyectando sombras danzantes sobre las rosas. Había un silencio profundo, roto solo por el crujir de las hojas y el susurro del viento. Finalmente, Gatsby apareció, con una expresión que no pude interpretar del todo. "Está a punto de suceder," susurró, y su voz era un misterio envuelto en promesas. Me pidió que me mantuviera oculto, que no dijera nada, que simplemente esperara. Pasaron horas, o tal vez solo minutos, antes de que el cielo se iluminara con un destello repentino. Un grupo de personas, vestidas con ropa de baño desgastada, irrumpió en el jardín, jadeando y riendo. Gatsby se acercó a ellos, y en ese momento, su rostro se iluminó con una mezcla de esperanza y temor. No sabía qué estaba a punto de suceder, pero sentí que todo cambiaría esa noche.

en_first_half: He talked a lot about the past, and I gathered that he wanted to recover something, some idea of himself perhaps, that had gone into loving Daisy. His life had
en_second_half: been confused and disordered since then, but if he could once return to a certain starting place and go over it all slowly, he could find out what that thing was…
en_results: been a series of missed chances, a string of half-hearted attempts at living up to the expectations others had for him. He had always been the quiet one, the observer,
en_results_raw: His life had been a series of missed chances, a string of half-hearted attempts at living up to the expectations others had for him. He had always been the quiet one, the observer, content to let others take the lead. But now, as he sat there, talking about Daisy, he realized that he had never truly lived. The love for Daisy had been a beacon, a guiding light, but it had also been a prison. He wanted to break free, to find himself again, to understand why he had let her go. The past was heavy, a burden he carried, but it was also the only thing he had left. He hoped that by talking, by sharing his thoughts, he could finally begin to heal and find the peace he had been searching for.

es_results_raw: Continuó hablando de Daisy, describiéndola como la única persona que realmente lo comprendió. Sin embargo, su amor por ella parecía haberse convertido en una especie de culpa, una carga que no podía dejar de soportar. A medida que avanzaba en su relato, se daba cuenta de que su vida entera había girado en torno a esa idea de sí mismo, una imagen idealizada que solo existía en su mente. Finalmente, admitió que tal vez nunca había amado a Daisy de la manera en que creía, pero que su relación había sido su refugio, su forma de mantener esa imagen intacta. Esto lo llevó a preguntarse si realmente había amado a alguien más en su vida, o si solo había amado esa idea de sí mismo que tanto había intentado proteger.

en_results_raw: output> The quiet lights in the distance seemed to pulse with a life of their own, as if they were watching them, waiting for something. The air was crisp, carrying with it the scent of damp earth and the faintest hint of woodsmoke. They stood there, the world around them fading into a hazy, dreamlike state. The past and present seemed to blur, the memories of that night intertwining with the present moment. She looked into his eyes, and for a brief second, time stood still. The stars above seemed to twinkle with a knowing light, as if they too were part of the story. The silence between them was thick, yet it felt like the beginning of something new. The wind whispered through the empty spaces, carrying with it the promise of change. They both knew that this moment, this place, would never be forgotten. The night stretched on, and with it, the possibility of what could come next. As the first light of dawn began to peek through the horizon, they turned away from each other, each lost in their own thoughts. The night had been a turning point, a moment of clarity, and both knew that their paths would never be the same again.

es_results_raw: continuación de la noche iluminaban el paisaje con un tenue resplandor. El viento soplaba suave, trayendo consigo el aroma de las hojas muertas que cubrían el suelo. En el horizonte, las primeras estrellas comenzaban a brillar, añadiendo un toque de misterio a la escena. Uno de ellos, un joven de cabello oscuro, se acercó al otro, un hombre más maduro, y le susurró al oído: "¿Recuerdas cómo era esto hace años?" El otro asintió, con una sonrisa nostálgica en los labios. "Sí, recordamos. Aquellos días eran diferentes, más simples, pero también más intensos. Ahora todo parece tan... distante." Se quedaron en silencio, contemplando cómo las hojas seguían cayendo, llevadas por el viento. La luna, grande y brillante, iluminaba cada detalle, creando una escena que parecía sacada de un cuento antiguo. Pasaron allí un rato, recordando, hablando en voz baja, hasta que el frío de la noche los obligó a partir. Pero el lugar, aquel espacio vacío bajo la luna, quedó grabado en sus mentes, como un recuerdo que nunca se olvidará.

La culpa fue mía, porque era uno de esos hombres que creen que todo es posible si solo lo intentas. Aunque Gatsby era un personaje complejo, no podía dejar de sentirme culpable por haberlo involucrado en mis asuntos. A veces, las amistades se rompen y las mentiras se desvelan, pero lo que más me duele es haberle fallado a alguien que siempre creyó en mí. Desde entonces, he aprendido que las palabras pueden herir más que las acciones, y que la amistad verdadera no se mide por los resultados, sino por la intención. Aunque el teléfono seguía sonando, decidí no contestar, sabiendo que no había nada que pudiera decir que cambiaría lo que había pasado.

Así que, cuando el humo de las luces de los automóviles se disipó, solo quedó un vacío que no podía llenar. Sentí que todo lo que había construido, todas las ilusiones que había alimentado, se desmoronaban como castillos de naipes. Cada vez que miraba hacia el horizonte, solo veía sombras y silencio. Era como si Gatsby nunca hubiera existido, como si todo hubiera sido un sueño. Y en ese sueño, yo había sido el último en despertar.

The room was quiet, save for the ticking of the old clock on the wall, as I approached the desk where the letter lay. My hands trembled slightly as I picked it up, the weight of responsibility pressing down on me. I had rehearsed what I would say in my head a hundred times, but nothing could prepare me for the reality of the moment. The words felt foreign on my lips, but they had to be said. Once it was done, I could finally breathe, and the weight would lift. I placed the letter back on the desk, my heart racing, and left the room, the door closing behind me with a soft click. The world outside seemed brighter, and the air felt lighter. I had done what needed to be done, and now I could move forward, not just trusting in the kindness of others, but knowing that I had taken responsibility for my actions.
